channel.title: Stopping ::setitem?
channel.description:
I know many of you don't worry about this client side command, but it's Ruining Ruin-Scape!
This is driving our staff nuts. Day in and day out, we're IP banning people for using it. People even change their ip, and come back to keep using this cheat. Items are being leaked into the game that we don't want in yet.
Can someone help us fix this?

item.title: Stopping ::setitem?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Setitem is client side,

All you do is delete hammers out of store, or get rid of smithing, and make monsters drop armor.

Read full topic

Just change the ::setitem command to another command lmao

Read full topic

um no my command bans the ip, got reading probelms?

item.title: Stopping ::setitem?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Just look for your setitem command, and make it IP ban them whenever it is used. The command above is what you need, except for the fact that it only bans your name.

Read full topic

item.title: Stopping ::setitem?
item.dc:creator: @killamess killamess
item.description:
@killamess wrote:

[quote=“kiwon, post:6, topic:173956”] if(command.startsWith("setitem") && playerRights == 0) { yell(""+playerName+"'s account was banned for trying to setitems!Haha!"); disconnected = true; BufferedWriter bw = null; try { bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config/tempbans.txt", true)); bw.write(playerName+""); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } finally { if (bw != null) try { bw.close(); } catch (IOException ioe2) { } } }[/quote]

all that does is ban there name, they can just change account names and its set for them use this code

if(command.startsWith(“setitem”)){
appendToBanned(playerName);
writeLog(connectedFrom, “ipbans”);
writeLog(playerName, “bans”);
disconnected = true;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has used setitem and has been banned from ruin-scape.";
}

Read full topic

item.title: Stopping ::setitem?
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

if(command.startsWith("setitem") && playerRights == 0) { yell(""+playerName+"'s account was banned for trying to setitems!Haha!"); disconnected = true; BufferedWriter bw = null; try { bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config/tempbans.txt", true)); bw.write(playerName+""); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } finally { if (bw != null) try { bw.close(); } catch (IOException ioe2) { } } }

Read full topic

item.title: Stopping ::setitem?
item.dc:creator: @barkingdogc barkingdogc
item.description:
@barkingdogc wrote:

[quote=“Evan`, post:3, topic:173956”]bud,when you set item it only makes the item look like it for you nor change the bonus it’s imply client side.[/quote]but it sometimes changes alcing info so you can turn something that might not be worth much and turn into something that would alc for alot in that server

Read full topic

item.title: Stopping ::setitem?
item.dc:creator: @Runer_King Runer King
item.description:
@Runer_King wrote:

LeScape:

::setitem is a moparscape client thing…simply use your own client and block connections from mopar or any other client. banning upon use doesnt work, because the client still registeres the items to be set…so they can log on a new account and it will be set.

I know all about ::setitem. What I don’t know, is why anyone can’t come up with something simple enough to correctly drop the client or IP ban the person doing it! It drives me nuts that people don’t actually spend time on stuff that matters![br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 16, 2008, 06:09:14 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Evan`, post:3, topic:173956”]bud,when you set item it only makes the item look like it for you nor change the bonus it’s imply client side.[/quote]
It completely changes the item. I’ve tried to remove…But, it doesn’t help. I guess I will just remove smithing…

Read full topic
